restaurants.name: J. Hollinger's Waterman's Chophouse
restaurants.description: An Art Deco-styled American chophouse and raw bar in downtown Silver Spring from restaurateur Jerry Hollinger, celebrating local farmers, watermen, and purveyors with steaks, seafood add-ons, and happy-hour oyster deals.

restaurants.name: The Daily Dish
restaurants.description: Mentioned as one of Jerry Hollinger's ventures (a restaurant/catering company) associated with the Waterman’s Chophouse team.

restaurants.name: Dish & Dram
restaurants.description: A separate Hollinger hospitality project referenced alongside The Daily Dish and Waterman's Chophouse.

restaurants.name: Aventino Cucina
restaurants.description: Mike Friedman's Roman/Lazio-inspired restaurant in Bethesda, serving airy pizza rossa, light salads, house-made pastas, and classic Roman dishes.

restaurants.name: Red Hen
restaurants.description: Referenced as a previous hit from Mike Friedman, noted as part of his track record of restaurants.

restaurants.name: All-Purpose
restaurants.description: Mentioned as another Friedman project; known for pizza and Italian-American offerings.

restaurants.name: Cielo Rojo
restaurants.description: Takoma Park favorite offering vegan-friendly, nixtamal tortilla–forward Mexican fare including sophisticated tacos, tostadas, enchiladas, inventive margaritas, and a weekend brunch.

restaurants.name: San Pancho Burritos
restaurants.description: A San Francisco–styled burrito concept that took over Cielo Rojo's old space; noted as the team's casual outpost.

restaurants.name: 2Fifty Texas BBQ
restaurants.description: Riverdale Park barbecue institution known for Central Texas oak-smoked brisket, beef ribs, pulled pork, and creative daily specials; expanded into Mt. Vernon Triangle.

restaurants.name: Thip Khao
restaurants.description: Columbia Heights Laotian standard-bearer from mother-and-son chefs serving fiery Lao dishes like tamarind-glazed wings, grilled pork shoulder with lemongrass, and papaya salad.

restaurants.name: Baan Mae
restaurants.description: A modern Southeast Asian eatery by the Thip Khao team, converted from their former cocktail bar Hanumanh, noted for pop-ups and casual brunch bowls.

restaurants.name: Padaek
restaurants.description: A Northern Virginia Laotian staple from the Thip Khao family that moved to a new Arlington home.

restaurants.name: Purple Patch
restaurants.description: Mount Pleasant institution and local Filipino restaurant celebrated for sisig, longanisa, tocino, vegetarian adobos, and ube desserts; owner also opened Joia Burger.

restaurants.name: Joia Burger
restaurants.description: Casual burger shop from Purple Patch's owner serving wagyu smash burgers, housemade bean burgers, and ube soft serve.

restaurants.name: Perry's Restaurant
restaurants.description: Adams Morgan spot known for sushi and Japanese small plates under chef Masako Morishita, offering drag brunch and special Japanese breakfast services.

restaurants.name: Elmina
restaurants.description: Eric Adjepong's modern brick-and-mortar spot showcasing Ghanaian and West African dishes like fufu, kelewele, egusi hummus, roti, and doubles in a two-story 14th Street dining room.

restaurants.name: Dawa
restaurants.description: A casual West African takeout counter operating inside Elmina offering approachable versions of Adjepong’s flavors.

restaurants.name: Ceibo
restaurants.description: Adams Morgan candle-lit restaurant from brothers Juan and Manuel Olivera celebrating Uruguay and South American asado with grilled meats, seafood, and a dimly lit downstairs bar.

restaurants.name: Bresca
restaurants.description: Buzzy bistro on lower 14th Street from chef Ryan Ratino offering inventive seasonal dishes, a well-regarded bar program, and chef’s tasting menus; sibling to two-Michelin-starred Jônt.

restaurants.name: Jônt
restaurants.description: Two-Michelin-starred tasting room located above Bresca, noted for its formal tasting menu experiences.

restaurants.name: Ômo by Jônt
restaurants.description: A related project to Jônt referenced in coverage of Bresca’s team, noted as part of the group's broader fine-dining ventures.

restaurants.name: Anju
restaurants.description: Korean bar-food restaurant between Dupont Circle and Adams Morgan serving mandu, gochujang-glazed fried chicken, bokkeumbap, and weekend brunch items like a galbi smash burger.

restaurants.name: Chiko
restaurants.description: The casual hit restaurant from the same group as Anju, noted for reviving an experimental tasting menu at its Capitol Hill flagship.

restaurants.name: Joon
restaurants.description: Tysons Corner restaurant earning national acclaim for upscale Iranian/Persian cuisine with inventive dishes like pistachio soup and braised lamb shoulder, plus an adjacent lounge called May Bar.

restaurants.name: May Bar
restaurants.description: A beautiful lounge in front of Joon’s royal blue dining room where diners enjoy cocktails infused with Persian flavors.

restaurants.name: SURA Restaurant
restaurants.description: Family-run underground Dupont lounge serving bold Thai dishes and experimental items like Parmesan-dusted egg noodles and khao soi from a red-lit bar and 50-seat lair.

restaurants.name: Mayuree Thai Tavern
restaurants.description: Baltimore Thai restaurant mentioned in relation to SURA’s beverage team, noted for its proprietor Andy Thammasathiti.

restaurants.name: Fat Nomads
restaurants.description: A supper-club project referenced as contributing destination dishes to SURA; cited in background about the team's contributors.

restaurants.name: Amparo Fondita
restaurants.description: Dupont restaurant from chef Christian Irabién offering modern Mexican coastal flavors, seafood-forward dishes, masa cakes, and multi-day mole negro preparations.

restaurants.name: Oyster Oyster
restaurants.description: Shaw-based vegetable-focused restaurant from chef Rob Rubba offering vegetarian and vegan tasting menus, honored with a Michelin star and a Michelin Green Star for sustainability.

restaurants.name: Shia
restaurants.description: A nonprofit hidden tasting-menu restaurant from chef Edward Lee offering cutting-edge Korean tasting menus with sustainable practices and both five- and seven-course options.

restaurants.name: Tabard Inn
restaurants.description: Century-old boutique hotel hideaway in Dupont with French-Southern–influenced dining overseen by executive chef Matthew Zafrir, serving crab fritters, local oysters, and seasonal vegetable-forward fare.

restaurants.name: Causa
restaurants.description: Fine-dining Peruvian restaurant in Blagden Alley offering a six-course prix fixe that explores Peru’s coastal and Andean bounty; run by chef Carlos Delgado.

restaurants.name: Amazonia
restaurants.description: The colorful, more casual counterpart to Causa with a tropical-themed atmosphere, casual skewers, and a leafy patio that starts service earlier on weekends.

restaurants.name: Unconventional Diner
restaurants.description: Convention-center–adjacent spot applying classic French technique to diner dishes, offering everything from chicken and waffles to mini-pot pie poppers and a bright bar.

restaurants.name: L’Ardente
restaurants.description: Mentioned as a next-door downtown sibling to Unconventional Diner, an Italian concept for diners seeking refined Italian options.

restaurants.name: Love, Makoto
restaurants.description: Japanese dining sibling to Unconventional Diner cited as part of the same downtown group.

restaurants.name: L’Avant-Garde
restaurants.description: Georgetown French Riviera–inspired showpiece offering saffron bouillabaisse, branzino, filet mignon, and theatrical lobster tasting menus under chef Sébastien Giannini.

restaurants.name: L’Annexe
restaurants.description: A sibling cocktail bar to L’Avant-Garde recommended for nightcaps, with a petite patio.

restaurants.name: Kyojin Sushi
restaurants.description: Georgetown sushi cave from the Yume Sushi team featuring adventurous offerings like truffle wasabi, monkfish liver, uni with torched wagyu, and hot izakaya items.

restaurants.name: Yume Sushi
restaurants.description: Outer Arlington raw fish hit from the team behind Kyojin Sushi, cited as the group's original restaurant.

restaurants.name: Rimtang
restaurants.description: Fast-casual Thai street food concept opened by Kyojin’s chef, showcasing family Thai recipes in a quick-service format.

restaurants.name: Imperfecto
restaurants.description: Enrique Limardo’s Mediterranean-Latin fine-dining restaurant in the West End serving surreal plating, wood-fired items, and an omakase tasting experience at the chef’s counter.

restaurants.name: Seven Reasons
restaurants.description: Referenced as Elmina’s former 14th Street home and the team’s previous tropically appointed concept.

restaurants.name: TheSaga
restaurants.description: Spanish-themed restaurant from Enrique Limardo opened in the Ritz-Carlton and mentioned as part of his expanding portfolio.

restaurants.name: Surreal
restaurants.description: An avant-garde bistro by Limardo located near Amazon HQ2 in Arlington, cited as part of his expansion into Virginia.

restaurants.name: Casa Teresa
restaurants.description: Rubén García’s flagship Spanish tapas and live-fire restaurant at The Square, serving family-style grilled meats, whole fish, and Catalan/Basque–inspired dishes.

restaurants.name: Cucina Morini
restaurants.description: Southern Italian restaurant in Mt. Vernon Triangle serving crudo, small plates, fish soup, and homemade pastas, part of the Altamarea Group.

restaurants.name: Osteria Morini
restaurants.description: The decade-old NYC sibling to Cucina Morini referenced as part of the larger Morini family of restaurants.

restaurants.name: Caruso’s Grocery
restaurants.description: Capitol Hill–born hit and part of the team roster mentioned in Cucina Morini coverage; known for Italian deli-style offerings.

restaurants.name: Nicoletta Italian Kitchen
restaurants.description: A former Italian concept combined into the new Cucina Morini location; referenced as part of building the new Italian spot.

restaurants.name: Brew’d cafe
restaurants.description: An adjoining cafe that was incorporated into the Cucina Morini project as part of the Navy Yard concept.

restaurants.name: Baan Siam
restaurants.description: Roomy Mt. Vernon Triangle Thai restaurant from chef Jeeraporn Poksupthon offering khao soi, tapioca skin dumplings, spicy-sweet salads, and Thai desserts like mango sticky rice.

restaurants.name: Tapori
restaurants.description: H Street South Indian/Nepalese restaurant from the Daru team focused on street-food favorites like pani puri, vada pav, dosas, and spiced cocktails.

restaurants.name: Daru
restaurants.description: Critically acclaimed H Street restaurant whose team opened Tapori; referenced as part of the same restaurant family.

restaurants.name: Centrolina
restaurants.description: Amy Brandwein’s polished osteria in CityCenter DC highlighting seasonal Italian dishes, pristine pastas, wood-fired mains, and refined desserts.

restaurants.name: Piccolina
restaurants.description: Amy Brandwein’s all-day sibling cafe to Centrolina, offering casual cafe fare across the street.

restaurants.name: Tonari
restaurants.description: Katsuya Fukushima’s wafu restaurant in Chinatown that fuses Japanese flavors into pizza and pasta, with thick square pies and inventive toppings.

restaurants.name: Izakaya Daikaya
restaurants.description: Neighboring ramen shop and izakaya by the same ownership as Tonari, cited as part of the local restaurant cluster.

restaurants.name: Bantam King
restaurants.description: Chicken ramen haunt mentioned as another concept owned by the Tonari team.

restaurants.name: Moon Rabbit by Kevin Tien
restaurants.description: Fine-dining Vietnamese restaurant in Penn Quarter from James Beard–nominated chef Kevin Tien, featuring contemporary Vietnamese dishes and acclaimed breads and pastries.

restaurants.name: The Occidental
restaurants.description: Stephen Starr’s reimagining of a downtown classic near the White House offering white-tablecloth service, tableside martinis, prime rib, lamb chops, caviar, and Champagne.

restaurants.name: Pascual
restaurants.description: Capitol Hill hearth-focused Mexican restaurant from Isabel Coss and Matt Conroy, highlighting whole grilled fish, smoked chicken, tamales, and Oaxacan flavors.

restaurants.name: SER Restaurant
restaurants.description: Ten-year-old Spanish stalwart in Ballston serving tapas, paella for two, and seasonal Spanish plates with a lively patio.

restaurants.name: Joselito
restaurants.description: Referenced as SER’s sister spot in Capitol Hill that recently closed; noted in relation to SER’s team focus.

restaurants.name: Dōgon
restaurants.description: Afro-Caribbean restaurant by celebrity chef Kwame Onwuachi at the Salamander Washington DC exploring Nigerian, Jamaican, Trinidadian, and Creole heritage with dishes like plantain hoe cakes and jollof rice.

restaurants.name: Ama
restaurants.description: Navy Yard Italian caffè and focacceria by Micah Wilder and Johanna Hellrigl that transitions from morning pastries and coffee to an aperitivo bar and Italian dinners.

restaurants.name: Fish Shop
restaurants.description: UK seafood concept that opened at the Wharf offering a fishmonger-style menu with crab-topped crumpets, grilled oysters, roasted rockfish, and produce sourced locally.

restaurants.name: Albi
restaurants.description: High-end Palestinian restaurant from James Beard Award winner Michael Rafidi centered on wood-burning hearth cooking, mezze, and a new Sofra tasting menu.

restaurants.name: Yellow
restaurants.description: Sibling cafe to Albi offering a more casual Levantine cafe experience, noted for expanding to Georgetown and Union Market.

restaurants.name: La’ Shukran
restaurants.description: Lev antine bar above Albi’s Union Market location described as a lively Levantine bar experience.

restaurants.name: Shilling Canning Company
restaurants.description: Navy Yard restaurant and raw bar from chef Reid Shilling focused on mid-Atlantic ingredients, seasonal tasting menus, and preservation techniques.

restaurants.name: Fancy Ranch
restaurants.description: The team’s Amish chicken pop-up in Union Market mentioned as a rotating concept associated with Shilling Canning Company.

restaurants.name: Mama Chang
restaurants.description: Home-style Chinese restaurant in Peter Chang’s portfolio serving Hubei-inspired numbing spice dishes, dim sum, and family-style plates; with a Fairfax dining room.

restaurants.name: Chang Chang
restaurants.description: Peter Chang’s Dupont Circle restaurant referenced as his first D.C. location with an extensive menu and supersized offerings.

restaurants.name: NiHao
restaurants.description: A National Landing Chinese concept from Peter Chang’s expanding portfolio mentioned as part of his 2024 openings in NoVa.

restaurants.name: Estadio
restaurants.description: A restaurant referenced as a partner to Rob Rubba when discussing Oyster Oyster; cited in relation to ownership and hospitality partnerships.

restaurants.name: L2 lounge
restaurants.description: Referenced as the former occupant of the space Kyojin Sushi later took over; cited as a prior local lounge tenant.

restaurants.name: Kintaro
restaurants.description: Former tenant of a nearby Georgetown space mentioned in relation to Rimtang’s opening.

restaurants.name: Patsy’s
restaurants.description: Referenced as a nearby place in the Joon section noting free self-parking in the lot in front of Patsy’s.

restaurants.name: Maison Bar a Vin (Maison DC)
restaurants.description: A wine- and bar-focused concept mentioned as part of the Popal Group’s neighborhood openings alongside Lutèce and Lapis.

restaurants.name: Lutèce
restaurants.description: Mentioned as a French Georgetown gem from the Popal Group, cited in the context of neighborhood restaurants they operate.

restaurants.name: Lapis
restaurants.description: Adams Morgan Afghan restaurant from the Popal Group referenced as one of the group's neighborhood restaurants.
